text.p: Berisford Property Developments Ltd, a subsidiary of Berisford International, said it has appealed a planning application to build 650 new homes on the site of a derelict, former sugar beet factory in Felsted.

The 50 hectare site in Felsted, Essex about 40 miles north of central London, provides direct access to fast growing Stansted airport. The local community has held up the development, arguing they have not had the oppurtunity to put their case at a public inquiry.
The appeal should initiate a public inquiry.

"They claim they are seeking to protect their villages but if they continue their court case and win all they will succeed in doing is preserving this derelict industrial site as a blot on the landscape and causing 650 houses to built on greenfield land elsewhere in the countryside," said Berisford Plc group finance director Jonathan Findler.
